page.title: 16Bird-watching in Uyeasound.
page.content: There are many birds around Uyeasound. I like black-headed gulls because of the way they fly and starlings because the light shows lots of colours on their feathers. When we need to find out about birds we go and see a keen ornithologist in Uyeasound.He has been interested in birds for 15 years because he likes nature.He is in the Shetland Bird Club and is interested in all birds.The rarest bird he's seen in Uyeasound this year is a bluethroat.If he can get near enough he takes photos of the birds.He is sometimes involved in bird counts.In the winter of 1984/5 he counted all the waders and eiders along a stretch of coastline in Uyeasound and Belmont,one hour after low tide.He sent the census figures to the British Trust of Ornithologists.
